intro: Anthurium chiriquense, commonly known as the Chiriquí anthurium, is a tropical plant native to Central America. It belongs to the Araceae family and is characterized by its striking, heart-shaped leaves and vibrant spadix flowers. The plant typically grows in humid, shaded environments, often found in the understory of tropical forests. Its foliage is glossy and can reach up to 1 meter in length, making it a striking ornamental plant. The spadix is usually bright red or orange, contrasting with the deep green spathe, which enhances its visual appeal.
